user_stories.title: Parent Account Creation and Management
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to be able to create an account using my email and password or via Google Sign-In so that I can securely access the RoutineRally application.
acceptance_criteria: User can sign up with email and password.
User can sign up using Google authentication.
User receives confirmation of successful account creation.
New parent profile is created upon successful sign-up.

user_stories.title: Child Profile Creation
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to create profiles for each of my children, including their name and age, so that I can assign activities and tasks to them individually.
acceptance_criteria: Parent can add a new child profile.
Child profile includes fields for Name and Age.
Optional field for child's profile picture is available.
Multiple child profiles can be created under one parent account.
Parent can edit existing child profiles.

user_stories.title: Add Recurring Class Schedule
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to add recurring class schedules (e.g., weekly music lessons) to the family calendar, including details like title, time, location, and notes, so that I can keep track of my child's ongoing commitments.
acceptance_criteria: User can initiate adding a new event.
User can select 'Class' as an activity type.
User can input event Title, Start Date/Time, End Date/Time, Location.
User can add Notes to the event.
User can select specific child(ren) for the event.
User can set recurrence to 'Weekly'.
User can define an end date for the recurrence or set it to 'No End Date'.
The saved event appears correctly on the calendar view.
Google Calendar syncs the newly added recurring event (if connected).

user_stories.title: Child Completes Assigned Task
user_stories.description: As a child, I want to easily view my assigned tasks and mark them as complete so that I can earn rewards and track my progress.
acceptance_criteria: Child can access a dedicated 'My Tasks' section.
Assigned tasks are listed clearly with due dates/times.
Child can tap a button to mark a task as 'Completed'.
A visual confirmation message is displayed upon task completion.
Reward points associated with the task are credited to the child's profile.

user_stories.title: Parent Creates a New '21-Day Kickstart' Program
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to initiate a '21-Day Kickstart' program for a specific routine (e.g., 'Morning Routine') by selecting associated tasks, so that I can help my child establish or reinforce new habits over a structured period.
acceptance_criteria: Parent can navigate to a 'Kickstart' or 'Routines' section.
Parent can start a new Kickstart program.
Parent can define a Program Title (e.g., 'Morning Routine').
Parent can select multiple existing tasks to be part of the daily program.
Parent can assign the program to one or more children.
Parent can select a Start Date for the 21-day program.
Upon initiation, the system generates the daily tasks for the 21-day duration and adds them to the child's task list.
A visual progress indicator for the Kickstart program is available.

user_stories.title: Google Calendar Synchronization
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to connect my Google Calendar to RoutineRally so that my family's schedule is automatically synced across both platforms.
acceptance_criteria: User can initiate the Google Calendar connection process from settings.
User is prompted to authorize RoutineRally to access their Google Calendar.
RoutineRally events created by the parent are visible in the connected Google Calendar.
User has the option to import events from Google Calendar into RoutineRally.

user_stories.title: Multi-Parent Family Sharing
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to share the family calendar and task lists with my partner so that we can both manage our children's schedules and tasks collaboratively.
acceptance_criteria: A 'family' can be established linking multiple parent accounts.
All parents within a family unit can view the shared family calendar.
All parents within a family unit can add, edit, and delete events on the shared calendar.
All parents within a family unit can view and assign tasks.
Task completion status is visible to all parents in the family.

user_stories.title: Define and Assign Rewards
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to define various rewards (points, custom rewards) and associate them with specific tasks so that my children are motivated to complete their responsibilities.
acceptance_criteria: Parent can access a 'Rewards' management section.
Parent can create new rewards, specifying a name (e.g., 'Extra Game Time').
Parent can assign a point value to rewards.
Parent can associate specific tasks or task categories with rewards.
When a child completes an associated task, the defined reward is automatically granted (or queued for approval).

user_stories.title: Child Views Earned Rewards
user_stories.description: As a child, I want to see the rewards I have earned and the total points I have accumulated so that I can track my progress towards redeeming them.
acceptance_criteria: Child can access a dedicated section to view earned rewards.
The list shows rewards previously earned.
The child's total accumulated points are clearly displayed.
A visual representation (e.g., progress bar, list) of rewards available for redemption is shown.

user_stories.title: Edit Existing Event
user_stories.description: As a parent, I want to edit existing events and activities in the calendar, including changing the time, date, or notes, so that I can easily manage schedule changes.
acceptance_criteria: Parent can select an existing event on the calendar.
An option to 'Edit' the event is presented.
Parent can modify any of the event details (Title, Date, Time, Location, Notes, Assigned Child).
Recurring events can be edited for a single occurrence or all future occurrences.
Changes are saved and reflected immediately on the calendar.
Google Calendar sync reflects the updated event details.
